page.title: 10Communication-Inf'ion system
page.content: Without public transport, the telephone has become invaluable to the villager. A high percentage of houes here have one and there is a box in the village centre which is frequently used. It is a life line to the emergency services which could come from any one of the surrounding towns at our need. Another welcome point of contact for many is the postal service with the familiar faces of the regular postmen always alert to possible emergencies arising to those living alone. Fornightly, a mobile library service comes to the village. The Dorset Blue Van visits once a week providing help and advice on all social problems and information on a variety of social welfare subjects. Two very important lifelines.
